intro: Caralluma crenulata, commonly known as the Crenulate Purslane, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Caralluma crenulata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
